I’m on a sale kick after spending the last two days shopping the Amazon Prime Big Deal Days event. The discounts, unsurprisingly, were huge, especially when it came to home essentials. My only complaint is that I wish it lasted longer — but thankfully, Pottery Barn has filled the sale-shaped hole in my heart. The editor-favorite brand just kicked off its Fall Sale, offering up to 70% off thousands of items. Pieces that have been tested and approved by AT are included, ranging from sofas to rugs to coffee tables.

What’s more, I went through the sale and narrowed down all of the best small-space-friendly finds, and even better, many of them have earned our stamp of approval. If you’re in need of a love seat that delivers top-notch comfort, a narrow organizer for your entryway, or a bed with built-in storage, you’ve come to the right place. Those and more gems are included in the list below, and many are hundreds of dollars cheaper than normal. Check them out ASAP!

1 / 10

Pottery Barn

$63.00

was $79.00

This nifty organizer will make the most of the area under your sink or the space underneath your desk (or wherever you tend to do your makeup). Measuring 18 inches tall and 10 inches wide, it can fit virtually anywhere, including inside cabinets, and the three drawers will keep your things orderly and out of sight.

2 / 10

Pottery Barn

$280.00

was $349.00

Hidden storage is key to making a small space functional. This find offers plenty, and it does it in style. Whether you use it as a footstool near your sofa or grab two for the foot of your bed, its simple design and beachy look make this storage cube one of the most stylish ones I’ve seen.

3 / 10

Pottery Barn

$508.99

was $999.00

Going vertical is another strategy you can incorporate into your tiny space. Shelving units like this one are a must, and it’s nearly half off. Its simplicity lends itself to its timelessness, as does the long-lasting solid mango wood that it’s made of.

4 / 10

Pottery Barn

$1599.00

was $1999.00

In our Personal Shopper series, the Carlisle earned the title of “Best Classic Style,” and it comes in a love seat size for small living rooms. Due to the S-curved base, intricate wood legs, and sloped roll armrests, we decided that it offers “a cozy marriage” between traditional and contemporary looks, perfect for “lovers of cottage core, farmhouse, and other vintage-inspired classic interior design.”

5 / 10

Pottery Barn

$298.99

was $499.00

Even if your entryway is narrow, this organizer leans against the wall and takes up hardly any space. It’s equipped with hooks, shelves, and storage bins in addition to a circular mirror, so you can store all of your accessories and put them on in one spot.

6 / 10

Pottery Barn

$719.00

was $799.00

Yet another Personal Shopper favorite is on sale! “Even though it’s big, the storage aspect still makes the table a good pick for small spaces, too,” our review of the Folsom table reads. “Whether you live alone in a studio or with your family in a house, this piece is beautiful and practical enough to serve as the center around which you gather with loved ones for movie night dinners and board game parties.”

7 / 10

Pottery Barn

$449.00

was $499.00

The 18-inch wide version of the popular Farmhouse nightstand is slim enough to fit into a tight space. Plus, its design will go with pretty much everything. Though it has a slight rustic flair, its appearance is sleek and no-frills.

8 / 10

Pottery Barn

$399.00

was $499.00

A rug will instantly make a space feel bigger, and you can’t go wrong with this editor-favorite option. “While jute lends durability, the inclusion of wool in the Chunky Natural Wool/Jute rug‘s weave is a warm and welcoming element in terms of both the look and feel,” we determined after testing it. “It’s reversible, has a consistent pattern throughout, and is a blend of neutral tones, so it’s ideal for layering indoors.”

9 / 10

Pottery Barn

$2239.00

was $2299.00

A sleeper sofa is a clever solution for those without extra rooms. The Pearce doesn’t sacrifice comfort for function with its thick arms, deep seat, and plush cushions filled with a down blend. Then, it turns into an equally cozy bed for overnight guests!

10 / 10

Pottery Barn

$1349.00

was $1499.00

Commerce SEO Editor Sarah swears by the standard version of the Astoria bed frame, so we have no doubt that the version with storage in its headboard is just as fantastic. If you don’t have room for a nightstand next to your bed, this is a smart solution.
